step.descriptionText: Study the weight and remember how much it weighs. Then press next.

We use a balance’s maximum weight capacity and its precision when determining which is the right choice.
This Microbalance has a maximum weight capacity of 5g and a precision of 1µg.
This Semi-MicroBalance has a maximum weight capacity of 210g and a precision of 0.0001g.
Click the button behind the balance to assume the balance leveling position. Use to rotate tool below to rotate the camera, then use the cursor icon to press the button.
Use the leveling screws to raise and lower the balance sides until the balance is level.
Use the cursor icon to click the button in front of the balance to access the balance’s face buttons.
Click the power button to turn on the balance.
After the display turns on, press and hold the tare button for a number of seconds then release and the readout display will ask for the calibration weight value. Press the Return button to continue.
Use the cursor to click the door handle used to slide open the door.
Use the forceps tool below to click the weight then click the weigh pan to move the weight inside the balance.
Close the draft door using the cursor tool.
Wait 10 seconds for the balance to beep to confirm that it is calibrated.
Use the forceps tool to remove the calibration weight.
Open the door with the cursor tool and then place the weight container on the weigh pan.
Close the draft shield door.
Access the face components then press the Tare button to zero the balance.
Return to the side view and open the shield door.
Click on the weigh material then click the weight container to pour in rice.
Close the draft shield door to get an accurate reading.
Wait for the reading to stabilize.
Take a closer look at the readout to accurately record the weight. Make sure the door is closed.
Use the rotate tool to look at the rear of the balance, then use the cursor tool to click the leveling button.
Use the leveling screws to raise and lower the balance sides until the balance is level.
Click the button in front of the balance to access the balance’s face buttons.
Use the power button to turn on the balance.
Press and hold the tare button for a number of seconds until the readout display asks for weight.
You must have the door open to place the weight on the weigh pan.
Select the weight by using the forceps tool to click on it and place it on the weigh pan by clicking on the weigh pan.
Make sure the draft shield door is closed before proceeding.
Wait 10 seconds for the balance to beep to confirm that it is calibrated.
Use the forceps tool to remove the calibration weight.
Place the weight container on the weigh pan.
Make sure the draft shield door is closed before proceeding.
Press the Tare button to remove the weight container’s weight from the reading.
Make sure the draft shield door is open.
Click on the desired material to select it. Once selected click on the weight container to add the material to the container.
Make sure that the draft shield door is closed to get an accurate reading.
Wait for the reading to stabilize.
Access the face components to complete the module.
